We were travelling by train to Figueres the next day and thought we knew what we were doing but wanted to check with the reception. The guy on reception nearly sent us in to town to catch the train and told us it was twice as much as we had researched before coming to Barcelona. We postponed the trip so we could go check it out first as it meant a very early morning wasted otherwise. As it turned out we were correct all along and we shouldn't of asked as it just confused us. The hotel was extremely noisy at night and our bed was really uncomfortable and everytime we moved it made a noise so we hardly slept. We never had breakfast at the hotel as they were charging 16 Euro's but only 2 doors away is a pastry shop which has the nicest croissants and on the corner is a coffee shop where a cup of coffee with milk (cafe con Leche) is only 1.35 Euro. There are loads of great Restaurants around which serve a selection of food but check the prices at the door of each first as they vary dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Manon066
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, the area is great with lots of nice restaurants and in walking distance of Passeig the Grazia and even better Rambla de Catalunya. The rooms are fine although a bit noisy. The rooftop terrace and pool are great. They have free internet in the lobby and a courtesy Fiat 500 for 4 hours during your stay which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the best in town !”
Reviews.Author: farCph
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, good breakfast, nice pool and jacuzzi on a fantastic roof !

Reviews.Title: “Bad Feng sui”
Reviews.Author: Locky1960
Reviews.Content: Modern enough hotel, with free wi fi. The rooms or at least the one we stayed in was a weird triangled shape. clean enough but unfortunately the air con was not working. we were told on arrival that the air con would be fixed within a day or so but when we left 4 days later it was still not working. I would not take my kids to this hotel, as the windows in the rooms open fully. should you have to get up in the night and make a wrong turn you could easily fall out. Staff were pleasant enough, and the rooftop bar/pool was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely visit again.”
Reviews.Author: mouthyelf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amercia for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The best bit is the roof terrace, with pool to cool down in after a long day sight seeing. There was usually a member of staff up there to provide towels, food and drink. It was lovely to drink champagne on the terrace early evening as the lights are turned down and the candles are lit. The breakfast was superb, lots of choice to suit all tastes - egg, bacon and sausages, bread, cold meats and cheese, cereal, yoghurts fresh and dried fruit, nuts, croissants and patisseries, fruit juices.... The room we had was a corner room with double bed and air conditioning. The room was very clean and the maid/housekeeper left my nightie arranged prettily on the bed like origami every day. The location of the hotel was great, just 2 blocks away from the nearest metro, 30 minute walk to Gaudi's unfinished cathedral, and 3 blocks from the tourist bus stops. There are many bars and restaurants within minutes of the hotel, in a very nice area of barcelona, with superior shops. Be careful of pickpockets in the more touristy areas including the metro (we nearly came a cropper on the metro but managed to foil them at the last minute) - however, did not feel this kind of threat in Eixample around the hotel. All in all, a lovely stay, ideal if you want a romantic break. Would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “single room with a window facing internal sapce”
Reviews.Author: DebbyWeisz
Reviews.Content: Liked: clean good breakfast free wireless location disliked: very noisy room, could not sleep due to elevator noise very thin walls, could hear the neighbors in their bath as if they were in my room couldn't open the window because every passer by could see the room from the corridor

Reviews.Title: “Lovely return visit, can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: julcull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 years ago had a great time so decided to return . Great little hotel , staff very nice and friendly . Rooms nice a bit small but very clean nice bathroom . We loved the roof top terrace amazing views too . Weather was superb making our stay even better . This time we walked everywhere didn't bother with metro , it's around 20 minutes down to La Rambla. Tended to eat local in the evening some nice places around if you look . Small bar next door to hotel ( to the left ) is nice Semi and his wife are very welcoming. We will return had a better time this time round did all the sights last time so just chilled and shopped and enjoyed the fantastic weather .Thank you Hotel America..

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: qprfraggle
Reviews.Content: The plus points: Nice, if small, roof terrace pool and jacuzzi Clean room, perfectly adequately sized (why do you need a huge room if you're going to be out and about on a city break?) The downside: Cheekily billed me in pounds not euros when I asked specifically for pounds. You get a much worse exchange rate when they do this and it's a cheeky way of them charging you more. Was late for airport when the cab they booked for me didn't show in time so didn't argue. Lots of UK stag groups when I stayed. The hotel has predominantly marble floors so sound canons around. I've been on stag groups and we try to stay away from hotels in quieter places where we can't effect others, or if there are others staying they're stag groups too. Not much the hotel can do about this but the groups weren't very pleasant. Room had no external window, only faced internally on to atrium inside. I like my daylight and this compounded the stag group problem. Overall, I'd go again but only on three conditions, (i) I would check what room I'm getting, (ii) that no stag groups are in town and (iii) that I'm billed for the rate I'm quoted.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel America Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mbwOH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked because of its proximity to my work location, but it is quite convenient to some lovely shopping. It provides room service for a light dinner and breakfast buffet. The rooms are clean and modern and the staff is helpful. Upon arrival the television did not work for a few days and initially the hairdryer in the room did not work (but the staff corrected the problem that day). Reasonable priced and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient”
Reviews.Author: IHeartUpgrades
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the America for 5 days on a business trip. I booked a superior room with wifi included; unfortunately, the wifi wasn't working when I arrived. But they had it working the next day and for the rest of the stay, and offered to knock of the cost of breakfast for two days to make up for it. I thought the breakfast was very good, very typical for a Mediterranean/European hotel. (Note that breakfast isn't necessarily included in the price.) The room was nicely minimalist, the bathroom was very nice and included a bidet; overall the room was great. Other reviews have complained about noise, but didn't have any problems in that regard. The bed was the firmest bed I think I've ever slept on, but I liked it. A problem I had, which hopefully is not a chronic problem for the hotel, is that a small but noticeable amount of sewer gas was seeping in through the drains in the bathroom. The management was aware of it and was working on how to resolve it. Barcelona had been going through a pretty severe drought, and I suspect that inadequate water flow in the sewers may have accounted for it. As it was, I was able to solve it by simply opening the windows for a few minutes (I do like hotels that allow you to open the windows). Despite that problem, and the one day outage on the wifi, I'd gladly stay at the America again. It's not absolutely top drawer, but it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good ,Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: sanandjezz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4nt stay at the Hotel America and having previously stayed off the Ramblas area I must say this was a far better experience of Barcelona. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were cleaned everyday to the same excellent standard. Initially we were on the 6th Floor just below the rooftop terrace and the room was excellent for getting to the pool and back however after a couple of days of experiencing drainage smells from the room which the hotel staff did try to rectify with chemical cleaners we were given the option of moving to the 3rd floor which we accepted. The only thing wrong with this from my own personal view was there was a lot more road noise and noise from building works that are going off just over the road from the hotel which appear to commence every morning at 7.30am. I found the breakfasts to be good and experienced none of the problems other reviewers have had, the food was plentiful and the service good. The pool area was clean everyday and there is bar service and food available at poolside if required. The reception was very helpful and always friendly and I would have no hesitation in staying here again.It was a very relaxing stay in a less touristly part of the city where you can easily get to the busier parts if required .

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean and a good location”
Reviews.Author: fiftysomething100
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the America. Staff were welcoming and efficient and the hotel is in a good area of Barcelona ~ safe and only a few minutes walk from the Passage de Gracia. It is very convienient for the metro. We stayed on the 6th floor, so noise from the road was not an issue. The rooms are modern, well equipped and very clean. The beds are hard, as is frequently the case on mainland Europe. There was no lock on the bathroom door and the cleaners ignored the 'do not disturb' sign on the bedroom, which caused my husband a little embarrassment one morning! We loved the roof terrace. As other members have commented, the pool is small ~ a splash pool really, but nice to cool off in after a day sightseeing. There is a shower, changing room and plenty of loungers, tables and settees; whilst we were there the terrace was relatively quiet. I'm an early riser and it was blissful to sit up on the roof with a book and enjoy the early morning sun. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. I took my own coffee up with me (made with travel kettle) and staff did not comment. It was equally good in the evening and we found it a good spot to meet up with friends for a drink before going out. At night it looks attractive with lights and lemon trees in pots, etc. Breakfast was great and we did not have the problems some members seem to have found ~ we had plenty of good hot food, coffee, fresh fruit, etc. The America is a reasonably priced, spotlessly clean hotel in a safe, quiet, area and we thought it was very good value for a hotel in the centre of Barcelona. We would happily recommend it, although after reading other reviews I think we had a very good room and other rooms may not be so comfortable. The only thing which would stop us booking again is that my husband found the bed hard. (I usually end up booking an american chain hotel for him, just for the beds!) If other members are going to Barcelona it is worth taking the hop on / hop off tourist bus ~ great value. We found several nice places to eat but the only one I can remember the name of was 'The Attic' ~ halfway up the Ramblas above the shops with an orange coloured entrance. (Other nights were obviously too good!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Voulez_vou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the America hotel 12-15th August with another couple and we loved it! We arrived at 11am to helpful and friendly reception staff and checked into our rooms with no problems. We loved the clean spacious rooms, comfortable bed, decor, lighting, free use of safe in the room and air con and the rooftop terrace with pool and jacuzzi. Whenever we wanted to relax by the pool there was always somewhere to lay down and sunbathe. The rooftop has lovely views of the mountains although the drilling in a nearby hotel did give me a bit of a headache but this isnt the hotels fault!! I just asked them to play some music and they did so without hesitating and it was good music at that!! We found the hotel's drinks and food were expensive so we had a drink in the bar next door at a fraction of the price, The hotel were so helpful and recommended a good restaurant down the road which did the most amazing tapas as we had a bad experience eating out on our first night. We checked out of our rooms at 12pm and our flight was at 10pm but we had use of the shower room in the gym and found this very useful. The hotel is in a good location being a 15-20 walk from the Ramblas and 30-40 mins from the Port and Sea. However this suited us as we like peace and quiet and found the buses and metro very useful and it saved our legs when we were tired and hot. Overall a very pleasant stay that made our trip to barcelona a memorable experience. Would definately recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “just not good!”
Reviews.Author: travelwurst
Reviews.Content: Design Hotel? quiet? roof top pool? forget about it! This was our 5th stay in Barcelona and mislead by many of the good reviews we decided to stay at America. What a disappointment! After changing room once we decided to move to a different hotel after the second night. This hotel might seem a good value for the money but it is not. The rooms are very battered, and we had the joy of seeing 2! off them since the first one was absolutely unacceptable. The second room we stayed in was loud and u could here ur neighbours chatter, the maid walking by the room and doing the service in the morning while still a sleep and the traffic in the street. The roof top pool is a joke, and u will not be able to find a space to lay down since there is very limited loungers and deck chairs. Do yourself a favour if u want a hotel check out something else! This is a 3 star hotel with a dodgy pool on the roof nothing else! For a few Euros more u can get much better hotels in Barca. BTW we moved to AC Miraramar.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the attitude of some staff members”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy16
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from my daughters hen party weekend. This hotel was recommended by the travel agent, so the staff knew well in advance thet seventeen females would be staying for two nights. On arrival, we were greated by two lovely members of staff who made us all feel very welcome. They showed us a map of the area and places of interest as we all wanted to see and experience the beautiful culture of Barcelona. Our rooms were clean, modern and comfortable and the amenities fine for a short break holiday. We all decided to relax and chat by the rooftop pool and this is where we were all made to feel like we just were not welcome. Some staff spoke to us very rudely without any obvious reason. On several occasions I was told to be quiet which I found extremely unreasonable as I am 50 years old and have never in my life been made to feel so unwelcome and very embarrassed. Other visitors did comment to us on how rude they thought the staff were towards us and with no obvious reasons as to why. So, if you are thinking of making a group booking, I would advise you to seek elsewhere and this is a real shame because the hotel itself is ideal for those lovely short city breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golden-mole
Reviews.Content: We had a short break in Barcelona and wanted a good hotel away from the Ramblas. The Hotel America is an ideal location in that respect. It is not too far from the subway and is within walking distance (well for me, it's about 2km) of the Sagrada Familia . There are a number of Gaudi buildings and the top end of the Ramblas within 500-600m. The Parc Guell is about 3km. The room was a good size with furnishings that are quite chic. The hotel has a small roof top pool and a small gym and sauna. There is a good Tapas bar just around the corner that is a fraction of the price of those on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichealaEdin
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the America in February for a long weekend. I'd read reviews before booking and, while the breakfast wasn't worth the money, we really enjoyed our stay so would side with the good reviews rather than the bad. The hotel was very clean, looked "trendy" enough for a teenage daughter, staff were very helpful and just friendly enough, the free internet was a boon and the rooftop area was lovely (although February wasn't the time to get the best from it). The situation of the hotel was great for sightseeing and we always felt safe in that area. Could walk to Ramblas etc, was cheap to get a taxi to and from Nou Camp (which is a great visit, even if you're not a fan). The pickpockets were out in force in the old town but they didn't approach us, i think because we made sure we had a tight grip of our bags (which were slung across our bodies) - much easier pickings elsewhere i suspect. You could see the same suspects moving from one tourist area to another - loitering and watching for unattended bags outside cafe's etc. Would recommend the bar/cafe across the street for a cheap meal - we ate late, like the locals, and the atmosphere was far better than in the more expensive restaurants...and watched Barca win on the TV! You could hear noise from the street from our room but it was just folk going about their business, more a bustle of activity than intimidating and troublesome like it might be in the UK. Just added to the atmosphere more than anything. Did have a slight problem with hearing folk in the next bathroom via the vents - we just whistled when in the loo and it was Ok really! I'd go back there but would probably look for a bigger, more luxurious, hotel if the stay was going to be longer than a weekend. Be aware of the added tax on bills for hotels and food which may affect your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very sufficient with great location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler08too
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend with two of my friends. I liked the location as it is in close proximity to the Ramblas and two blocks away from Casa Mila. It is also around the corner of the Palacio Flamenco where we booked dinner and the show. The rooms were spotless with a full bar, three robes and enough towels. Beds were comfortable and sheets clean and fine and when window's closed, no noise coming from outside. Internet access and bar available anytime and breakfast was great! Staff weren't overly friendly but they were helpful when needed. I didn't find Catalonians being too friendly in general. They are quite reserved. The terrace has a pool and lounge chairs/sofas that is great for relaxing! Overall rating for this hotel with great value, I give it between 4 and 5 stars! I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A pity about breakfast”
Reviews.Author: racoulter200752
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed twice in this hotel 6 years ago, before it was given a make-over. When I arrived last Friday afternoon, the reception staff were friendly and efficient. No problems them. On the Saturday morning I went down to breakfast at 10.30a.m. as breakfast was being served until 11a.m. When I opened up the chafing dishes there was not enough scrambled egg to cover a piece of toast, a few slices of bacon and eight coctail sausages. Although there was a good choice of cold meats, cereals etc. I decided to have a piece of toast and some coffee. I was asked what I would like to drink and I said coffee. That was the last time I was offered anything by the waiters. I asked for a second cup of coffee about 10minutes later, not having been offered a refill. My husband joined me at 10.55am and had the time pointed out to them as they would be stopping service at 11a.m. No pronlem as he had taken what food he wanted. At 11.05a.m. we asked for more coffee as the food was being taken away but we were told there was no more coffee. It took a trip to reception to persuade the waiter to give us more. The previous weekend we has stayed at the 5star PGA golf hotel in Girona. What a difference. The service there at breakfast had been impeccable. The staff went out of their way to refill cups and ignored the closing time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nice”
Reviews.Author: djeejn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern, breakfast was very good, fresh juices, hot and cold breakfast. We first got room 201, just make sure you don't get this room! It was incredibely noisy, because it is just in front of the two big roads and has large non-isolated windows. We asked for another room after a night of non-sleeping and we got room 209 which was very calm and not noisy at all. It's true that the rooms are a bit noisy, but hey, you're in a hotel in the middle of a big city... If you can, ask a a room at the back of the hotel, no noise from the outside and less neighbouring rooms... Rooms are not very big, but again... it's a hotel in a big city. Service was ok, we got free bottles of water the day we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great value modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short 5-day stay at the Hotel America, which lived up to its reputation for being modern with great service and facilities. It is in a "quieter" location though there is still some traffic noise which is slightly invasive. The rooms are clean and well maintained, and the service from the staff was excellent. Free internet access was appreciated and the reception staff even helped to book tables for us at our restaurants of choice! For a four star hotel near the centre of barcelona this is a great place to stay and is fabulous value. Try and book a higher level room to avoid the noise from the streets!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: enricoo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a few days ,on the internet and got a very good price. Shop around for the best price ...we found massive variations. The reviews on this site were accurate as far as i was concerned . It is a good value for money hotel in a very good area of barcalona . We felt safe day and night in this area. You need to look at a map of the city to see where it situated. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to the Ramblas .we tend to walk everywhere but Metro stations are very near by to the Hotel. The rooms are of a good size and we had uprated room on the front which was excellent ...no problems with noise. The breakfast was good quality...staff were pleasant ...nice small restaurent area . The area on the roof with the pool and seating area is a useful bonus weather permitting . Overall I enjoyed my stay at this hotel ...good staff, felt safe , good quality ,modern ,clean ...just what we needed for a city Break ..and would go back.. In the area across the road there are a number of cafes/restaurents of all price ranges ...we used the Ramplax during theday ,used by all the locals and very good value .Friendly with a good atmosphere.There are numerous excellent eating places in this area .

Reviews.Title: “Noisy week to go”
Reviews.Author: liflaf
Reviews.Content: our visit coincided with a European Champions League football match being Rangers hosted by Barca. That was coincidental & hopefully should have been of no consequence to this review. The motto of the hotel is Simply Different. When we checked in we expressed an interest in this fixture & were told that tickets could be provided....the ones which were available were 250 euros each (face value 70)..simply different. The hotel was central and fairly noisey but what we didn't bargain for was that a travelling group of football fans stayed for 3 nights in increasingly poor behaviour which badly affected our sleep. When raised with reception they apologised but in short said that these people were loco and there was nothing they could effectively do. This isn't a cheap place & I expected a lot better. The room was clean but pokey. There was no inclusive breakfast. The pool on the roof terrace was miniscule.All that said the staff were pleasant & courteous. Okay a bit gripey and I suppose having just returned after a dose of food poisoning (a menu del dia paella) has soured my view somewhat. Give me the citta eterna any day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travlil
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Barcelona for business and had a tight budget due to the Euro being so high. I booked this hotel based on the reviews and was not disappointed. The service was good, the hotel rooms were spotless and everything seem fairly new. The downside was that I had a room near the elevator and I heard everything inside the hotel. The way the interior was set up; noise just bounces off the walls. The location wasn't too bad. It was not too far from the main areas such as Passage de Gracias; it was only a 5 - 10 minute walk; and probably about a 20 minute walk to the Ramblas. One night I was extremely tired and decided to just ask the hotel for a dinner recommendation (I usually never do this) and I regretted it. The front desk recommended Trobadero and the food just was not that good. I also don't recommend eating at the little Meditteranean bar next to the hotel. It's much better to go to the Boqueria during the day for lunch and go to Barceloneta for dinner. If would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexDavies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Loved the hotel, and the location is great. Quiet area of Barcelona, with close access to metro, and Diagonal. Roof top pool is small, but it's a great place to lounge on a sunny afternoon. Rooms were spotless, and spacious, although TV remote was broken. Free internet access in lobby is useful, staff really friendly and helpful. Fab idea is the free use of the hotel car for 4 hours if you need - could be good for sightseeing/getting out of city, if you're brave enough to drive in the city! Only problem was that when paying, they converted the bill to £GBP using their own (very poor) rate, without asking (I would have paid in Euros and tken the bank rate any day) Would highly recommend, and would look to stay here agaion on my next trip to the city

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Pats_mcc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a really pleasant surprise. We really enjoyed our four night stay at Hotel America. It's a really good value, very modern hotel in a peaceful neighborhood. The neighborhood is walking distance to Las Ramblas but a lot more upmarket. There's plenty of cafe's and shopping nearby and it's very close to a metro stop. (Diagonal, I think) The Hotel is boutique size (7 floors) with modern furniture and wood flooring in the rooms. We shared a twin room and there was room for two suitcases, an armchair and coffee table and still plenty of space to walk around. The bathroom was large including a full-size tub. The breakfast buffet is good also - fruit, cereal, pastries, sausage,eggs etc The roof terrace is a bonus for a hotel at this price range - pool, sun lounges and day beds and they deliver room service to the terrace. We really enjoyed having somewhere to relax after walking around all day. I would definitely stay here again. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for people who won't/can't walk very far as it is 10 mins on the hoof to Las Ramblas, but if you're not fussed on the tourist tat down there then try this hotel. This is a real treat if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - cannot fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Sazzel7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel America for a week with my Partner and we absolutely loved it - probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in! The rooms were comfortable and very clean and the hotel was modern and clean throughout. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much bother at all. The roof top terrace was excellent a great place to relax after a days sightseeing! The breakfasts were excellent as well there was so much to choose from and everything was fresh and plentiful. The hotel also sell some gifts in the reception area which we found were a very reasonable price compared to the gift shops we went to. There are lots of nice places nearby to eat but I would definitely recommend a place called The Attic on Las Ramblas and also the Fairy Forest themed pub next to the wax museum. We booked our stay through Octopus Travel and got a very good rate which included breakfast. Already saving up for our trip back to Hotel America!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelanieBelfast
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay at the hotel america. The rooms were clean and spacious enough even though there was 3 adults in the room. I don't understand how people said it was noisey as we never heard a thing. The breakfast was spot on enough for us all fresh fruit salad ,croissants, cereals, cold meats ,bacon & scrambled eggs etc . The staff were very helpful & couldn't do enough for you really. And what about the rooftop pool area. It was fantastic a lovely place to chill out in the morning time after breakfast before doing the siteseeing. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. We booked this hotel through greatlatedeals.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Hotel America, a Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: djmsooty
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the review on this hotel I was a little seceptical; however I decided to go ahead and book! What a good idea, I used a website Otel.com which saved me about £100 from other sites and included breakfast too. The Hotel itself is very pleasant, fantastic service and a good location too. The Hotel is in the middle of Barcelona so dont expect breathtaking views from the pool terrace or your room, but then you need to pay for that sort of priveledge in Barcelona. The pool area is brilliamt, very pleasant and just what you need after a days sightseeing! The staff where excellent, always polite and very helpful! Breakfast was assorted and more than most could manage with a brilliant slection. The room we had was tidy, well decorated and very pleasant, there was a little noise at night as mentioned by the other reviews but nothing more than any other hotel or the air-con :-) Food in Barcelona isnt cheap but look around and you'll find some top places, try the Tai Resturant across the road, excellent food and good price too. Another good resturant is La Dol A Herminia, google it or ask the Hotel staff, it serves fantastic food and is well priced! Overall the Hotel was very good, pleasant and brilliant value, I have stayed in many English Hotels and never have I had a letter left in the room the day before checkout wishing us a plesant journey home! Well done Hotel America!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan185
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our stay at Hotel America. The location was near the Gaudi sights on a quiet street in a lovely section of Barcelona. For other sights, a three block walk brought you to a subway which could connect you to all parts of town. In the area around the hotel, there were many cafes available for lunches or dinner. The modern decor of the hotel lifted one's spirits. We enjoyed the roof top pool after a day of sightseeing in the Barcelona sun. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. We were happy to have stayed at the Hotel America. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel America”
Reviews.Author: Miss_P_Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Barcelona staying at the hotel America.Loved the hotel especially the rooftop pool and terrace. Great place to chill after being out and about with the option to order food and drink to the terrace. The hotel was clean with modern decor. More of a boutique style hotel. The staff were nice, friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable with a free room safe which was a welcome find. The hotel had a small bar next to the reception which had a computer with free internet access. There was also a small gym(which provided water) and a sauna.Breakfast was great and although there was no restaurant this did not affect us as we were happy to eat out at the many restaurants within walking distance. Found some lovely seafood restaurants down at Port Olympic( a taxi ride away) which were extremely popular. Passage De Gracia was a 5 min walk away and it was about 15 min walk to the top of Ramblas.There was a subway one block from the hotel which was great if the feet needed a rest. An added bonus was the hotel's Smart car which you could have, for free, for 4 hours. We managed to borrow it hassle free and headed to a shopping outlet. The only cons were, the room had no drawers at all,there was no iron( ironing service available at a price), the air con occasionally became noisy which if you were a light sleeper was at times very annoying (you became too hot when it was switched off) and there was a bit of noise from the other guests returning at night. There were repairs to the roof terrace being carried out for 3 days, after we left, resulting in the pool area being closed. Thankfully this did not affect us as this was our haven for the duration of the holiday. The thing I noticed about Barcelona were the constant warnings about pick pockets, when you were sitting at restaurants and going into bars. Thankfully we had no encounters. All in all I would definitely return to hotel America and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Longdrive
Reviews.Content: In our opinion the location of the Hotel was idea as it is situated in a nice quiet area that provided many eating and drinking options close by and was within easy walking distance to the tourist oriented areas like Las Ramblas and the upmarket shopping streets of Gracia and Catalunya. The Hotel is a smart, chic establishment with clean modern design lines. The rooms are comfortable, clean and provide all the facilities that you need. The restaurant serves breakfast only, but they do it very well with a great variety of food from cereal to smoked salmon. The pool and spa on the roof looked good but the weather was a bit cool to go in. In the bar a free internet terminal is provided for guest use. One of the best things that we liked was that we arrived at Hotel at 5.30am after an early flight from Cairo and we were able to get an early early check in to our room without any hassle. We have no hesitation in recommending Hotel America.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CANDYMUM3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel America in March 07 and had a nice time. We did find it a bit out of the way especially after a long day sightseeing. Very noisy at night and couldn't sleep with windows open. We were serenaded at 5.15am by buskers outside and this went on for an hour, and was repeated again the next morning!! Breakfast was lovely and staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragon999Cardiff
Reviews.Content: a great location - a five/ ten minute walk away from the busy ramblas area-perhaps more suited to people who have been to barcalona before and are more confident about exploring on their own. Rooms and facilities are more business - like than plush- but everything you need provided . Staff very friendly and attentive-i sprained my foot on the third day and could not walk -without me even asking they went away and found and gave me some crutches!! No restaurant but this gives you every reason to explore excellent restaurants literally on your doorstep for evening meals - "pulpo" and "provenza" are opposite and provide great food at great prices. Breakfasts can also be found cheaply minutes away eating with spanish locals One of the main reasons I booked was the roof garden whick has a very small pool and sunbathing areas - this came in very handy when I could not move for a day - I sat on the extensive decking under sun umbrellas and had food and drinks delivered throughout the day by willing and friendly staff - I will definately being going back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesBelgium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. I'm staying there right now. Breakfast is more than ok. Interior is nice. But I expect that for the price I pay. It is a bit expensive for such a hotel. 172 euro per night for a superior room of 1 person... There is wireless internet coverage in the hotel. You have to pay for that, but don't do that. Just go near the window in your room and try to get on one of the non-secured networks. There are several! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “We all loved this fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldengirlsDumfries
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 nights at this splendid hotel with 5 other female friends. 1st April to 5th April. The Hotel America is very friendly, very clean and the breakfasts are superb. It is a pleasant 10/15 minute walk from the hotel to Las Ramblas. It is situated in a very nice and quiet area where there are lots of nice shops. The restaurants round about are many and varied so you will never be stuck for somewhere to eat. The rooftop swimming pool and sun terrace are lovely but unfortunately we didn't get a chance to use them because it rained for our entire stay!! Instead we got to use the bar area!!. However this gives us a good excuse to return and it will certainly be to the Hotel America!

Reviews.Title: “More an Inn than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: At 106 UK Pounds per night and based on previous Tripadvisor reviews, we felt that we had chosen a quality accommodation option by booking America Hotel for our first visit to Barcelona. Sadly, the hotel came up very far short of our expectations. For a start, the location is not ideal, being situated on a side street in an area well north of the city centre. The hotel has one very small lounge room on the ground floor with a few chairs. This sole public room also contains a bar and the check in desk. On the first floor there is a small breakfast room but no restaurant. Did no previous reviewer think of pointing this out?? The bedrooms are very clean and minimally furnished. The beds are rock hard. The TV has 8 Spanish channels and about 8 other foreign channels, including CNN, which are blurred and grained with very poor reception. The bedroom windows leaked rain water unto the floor - we did get a room change but the second room had the same problem. The maid left a towel beneath the window for the duration of our stay. This is an Inn type property and not at all a full service hotel. We were left to ponder how, with such limited services, it ever managed to be classified as 4 star and how on earth it ever reached 16 th place on the Tripadvisor popularity ratings. We would not return, even at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent birthday suprise”
Reviews.Author: Rendan
Reviews.Content: Last year i wanted to give my boyfriend a weekend barcelona. I booked by our travelagent in Holland. Because i had a question about our luggage ( we checked in very early) i sent them an email. There was absolutely no problem. I told them it was my boyfriends birthday present, and they promised me we would have a weekend to never forget. I also upgrade our room to a superior. When we came in, our room was allready been cleaned, so we could check in right away! They said "happy birthday" to my boyfriend and in the evening we were suprised by staff with a bottle champagne and a birthdaycard!!! We were there for 3 days, everything was clean, and nothing was to much for them! The top of the hotel was absolutely BEAUTIFULL!!!! It was a lounge area with a nice pool and very nice jacuzzi. The last day we had to be at the airport late in the evening, so they had a service for our luggage for the last day. Next time in Barcelona we will be in hotel America!

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Megsy
Reviews.Content: Great ambience. Excellent staff who were all very helpful. Use of Smart car for 4 hours during the stay to tour the city, which was unique and unexpected! Breakfast was excllent, with great selection and something for everyone. Modern interior. My only comment would be that the air conditioning was turned off for Winter and the rooms were very hot - too noisy to sleep with the window open. Excellent location - 5 minute walk to La perdrera and the tourist bus stops. 2 minute walk to nearest Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: swans40
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and modern. Great location away from the noise of the centre. I stayed here for two nights with my husband and our son. We arrived just after 12am on the first night and was disapointed that we were unable to get room service even though their leaflet in the room stated it was available 12am-11pm. As we were peckish we decided to have some crisps and peanuts from the mini bar in our room but to our horror they were all out of date. The receptionist apologised in the morning, however when we arrived back later that day the out of date food was still there. We has prepaid for breakfast which was slightly disappointing. On holiday we tend to go for a cooked breakfast as a treat but there was only scrambled egg, bacon & sausage. The cereals, yogurts and fruit were nice anyway. We wouldn't go back here again as we prefer more bigger and lively hotels. The staff were all nice and polite. We booked this hotel through (--) which I would recommend. We went with them last year to Tenerife and I cannot fault them.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: georgeNorthOfEngland
Reviews.Content: We were really delighted with the hotel - it is in a great location , close to the Rambla and Passeig de Gracia with lots of bars and restaurants close by. It was spotlessly clean , the staff very friendly, breakfast excellent. The roof terrace and pool were lovely. Our only concern was that our room was very warm but the airconditioning was switched off because it was on a winter setting so could only be heated. However it was good to be able to open the window and although there was traffic noise it didn't bother us ( we live in the country where there is no noise usually!) We were a bit apprehensive that other people had mentioned that the hotel was noisy and they could hear other guests but we did not find it to be a problem any more than any other hotel. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights whilst we went sale shopping. We had a standard room, which was a reasonable size and very tastefully decorated (minimalistic with darkish wood floors and furniture) with one blue wall, which with the mirros on the opposite wall looked like the sky (well kind of)! The bathroom was a good size and it made a change to have one with outside light. We had requested a quiet non smoking room, which we got - the room was at the back of the building so no street noise. To be honest the only noise we heard (having read some of the other reviews) was that of other guests slamming doors/talking loudly -although didn't hear them at night/early morning and not really a problem and no different from any other hotel. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. In the bar area you can get free access to the internet and there is a selection of guide/art books you can browse through. The hotel also stocks a selection of magazines which you can borrow. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as we felt at E14.75 it was a bit steep (unless you can eat a big breakfast). Instead we went to one of the many cafes in the area. The hotel is in a good area and about 5 mins walk to the Passeig de Gracia and 15 mins walk to Placa Catalunya. There are loads of restaurants and bars near the hotel so it is very easy to stay local after a day of shopping/sightseeing etc. Whilst we did not use it (being Jan) the hotel has a great roof terrace/pool and looked a great chill out place, especially on a summers evening with a glass of cava catching the late sun! The hotel has a very small gym and sauna in the basement. We did use the sauna, which was fine. We would definately go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy, but very adequate”
Reviews.Author: lulujack
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews with heart pounding horror - we'd already booked Hotel America. However, it's a very nice hotel, understanding staff, good breakfast and the rooms are what you'd expect - they even gave us bath robes which was a bonus (I'm easily pleased!). The 'bar' is on the small side - OK, it's minute. And hardly comfortable, so the hotel should be considered a room for the night not a place to get socialising. It's one stop away from the Rambles and one night we had to get a cab back as the metro was closed. For this reason only I'd have picked another hotel more in the 'heart' of the city. But if you don't want to pay over the odds, want somewhere comfortable this is the place for you. Oh, we booked via TravelRepublic - that's a great site with the best deals I've found. And, believe me, I look!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it.”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNesterAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Barcelona, and I had no idea what to expect. I was extremely pleased. The hotel was clean, which is an absolute must for me. The staff was very helpful. (Perhaps it helps that I can speak Spanish). My husband and I were not disappointed. We were pleased by the location because it was so near to Las Ramblas, but far enough that we did not have to deal with city noise.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel America, a nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: xpcdoojk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Hotel America in late December. The rooms are very modern and very nice. I really liked the location and the hotel. It is located about 3 blocks from the main area of interest. It is an excellent location to base a stay to explore the most interesting parts of the city. We were able to walk all over the Las Ramblas neighborhoods and the Gothic district. We even walked to the Sacred Familia Cathedral in no more than 15 minutes one morning. The breakfast is more than adequate although they do run out of things if you wait too long to go to breakfast. The negatives for us were that the street noise is pretty loud in the room. We were on the 5th floor and it was difficult to sleep. This is complicated by the fact that the air conditioning is not on while they are in heating mode and they keep the hotel halls very warm at least on our floor. This meant in order to sleep we had to open the windows to cool the room, which meant that the noise became much worse. Our methodology evolved to where we opened the windows in the evening to get the room cold and then closed them to go to bed. The other problem was that the beds didn't have a top sheet but a very nice down comforter. This means that you are either under the comforter or exposed, this is hard for me to regulate my sleeping comfort temperature. This set up though is very typical in Spain, and it is hard to fault the Hotel America for this. Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tennismom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the America Hotel before our cruise. It was much better than I anticipated. It is a small, boutique type hotel that is immaculate. The rooms were average size for a European hotel, with a nice decor. The breakfast that came with my package was one of the best that I have had in Europe. Not only croissants and coffee, but eggs and ham or bacon, cereal, fruit, etc. Enjoyed the staff. They were very patient with all of my questions. Very pleasant. They have a computer in the lobby that is free, so you can check your emails. Very nice. Wasn't ever a wait. My husband will tell you that I am very picky when it comes to hotels. I have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: blackeyes
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Hotel America, Barcelona. Took a little time to actually find the hotel but when we did we were met with a friendly and efficient check in. Had a great room on the 6th floor- all our requirements were met - we had requested direct with the hotel that we had a room on the top floor, non smoking, away from the elevator and a bath and shower - oh and a king size bed. Slight road noise at night but that is the only negative. Fabulous breakfast spread - including chocolate - a first I must say - and delicious too. The breakfast room is lovely and bright and again great serving staff. Also found a fantastic restaurant around the corner - called Lagrantasca I think. Ate there 3 times in 4 days - greedy or what. Staff again were great and food and ambience very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay in a hotel...ever. No, really.”
Reviews.Author: rikkelly
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review on Tripadvisor, a website I have been using for the last couple of years as a source of useful information for booking hotels around the world. Very selfishly I have not before posted as the really great hotels I have stayed in have remained my secret and I have not had a really bad experience warranting a bad review. This one was, however, an absolute howler and I feel compelled to give my fellow travellers a 'heads up'. Having booked two standard rooms for one Saturday night we arrived in Barcelona and turned up at the hotel at 11.30. The rooms were not ready (they were not meant to be). No problem, we thought we´d go for a walk and a spot of lunch. When we returned we were given our room keys. I had made a very strong and explicit request for no smoking rooms. Both of our parties were non smoking and the smell of smoke triggers my asthma. As soon as the door to our room opened a haze of smoke emerged. It was as if the previous occupant had left only 10 minutes before and had left a cigarette burning in an ashtray. We returned to reception to be met by a frosty and frankly ambivolent attitude. We were given two wholly unacceptable options, keep the room and lump it or move to a single room (they call it a double for single occupancy, but the description bends any common sense view of those words. Having viewed the aforesaid broom cupboard we returned to reception and expressed our displeasure. We were told the hotel was full and so there was nothing that could be done. If we were not happy we should leave. Had we not been with friends who were already mid afternoon siesta that is exactly what we would have done. We had no option but to take the small room. To explain how small this room is you should picture struggling to get two small bags in, having to pass the end of the bed sideways and having to put the bags on the bed to open the cupboard. Its only saving grave was a modestly sized and quite well appointed bathroom. The room in question is the same on each floor of the hotel and always ends in the number 10; so we stayed in room 110. The room is wedged in an inner corner of the hotel and has no natural light. Also, because the room is so small our heads were about 1 metre from the marble floored corridor and about a foot from the maids cupboard. This resulted in one of the noisiest stays in a hotel room I have had the misfortune of suffering. I am a very heavy sleeper and I found it intollerable. I have stayed in many hotels in Barcelona some luxurious, some budget and this is without question, by a country mile, the worst stay I have had. In fact, it may be the worst stay I have had worldwide. The hotel as a whole is small, modern and trendy and I can see why many people recommend it. My experience was, however, disastrous. Hotels distinguish themselves in how they react when things go wrong rather than how they react when everything goes according to plan....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kjartan
Reviews.Content: We can only praise the hotel and agree it is a wonderful place to stay. Four of us went last weekend and had a great time. The hotel is immaculate, staff very friendly and they even upgraded my parents to a superior room as it was my dad's 60 birthday present. The rooms are fantastic and my husband and I stayed in a standard room which was also very spacious with a great bathroom. The superior room had a jacuzzi bath and DVD and CD player extra and a much bigger bed. The breakfast was wonderful with so much choice and Barcelona is a great city. We all had fantastic tapas in the Taverna Mediteranian located next door to the America Hotel and the food and drink was very reasonable and also fantastic service. The roof top area of the hotel is wonderful and views good over the city and a great place to relax after a busy day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: my2emeralds
Reviews.Content: Hotel America is not a bad choice if you're planning a trip to Barcelona. The staff was nice, especially the overnight receptionist. The pool are is nice also, though the hot tub is not very "hot" at all. We were there in September and the water was way too cold. The location is pretty good. You can't really walk to Las Ramblas, but the subway is easy to figure out. We got a rate of 100 euros per night on Expedia, and you definitely can't beat that! DVD players are available to rent for 10 euro a night. That was great b/c I found myself dying to hear some english and the only english channel is CNN. I definitely liked this hotel much better than our second hotel. We THOUGHT we wanted to be closer to Las Ramblas, so we switched to the H10 Catalunya for our last 3 nights there. BIG MISTAKE! The closer you get to the "tourist area", the hotels get more expensive, hotel rooms get smaller, and restaurants get more expensive. I'd definitely recommend Hotel America!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: kiddo74
Reviews.Content: I changed my reservation from another hotel to Hotel America because of the good reviews in here. They have nice features like free internet access, nice pool, dvds to rent and a stereo in the room (we stayed in a superior). But I still have to say I was very disappointed and would never return. We, my husband and I, arrived here after two great nights at Barcelona Princess close to the beach. We wanted to be in the city center to do some shopping, which is why we chose America. The hotel is not far from Passeig the Gracia, and you can catch the railway a few blocks away. We were greated ok, and firstly given a room on the 2. floor. The window would not close properly and the traffic outside can be quite noisy at times. We got a new room on the 6. floor and were happy about that. The problem was the paperthin walls, the banging doors and the marble floor in the hallway...which we more than got our share of with a group of loud, noisy and drunk people next door. We were waken with a shock, tried to knock on the wall to silence them, which only resulted in one of them knocking on our door. I realise we were very unlucky, but I treasure some privacy when I pay this much for a nice hotel, and the way the interior is designed, this is really not possible at the America. We also woke up the next morning with aching backs from the quite hard mattrass and found no reasons to stay the second night as booked. We found a hotel nearby and got a better deal for the last night. America is absolutely overrated, both in reviews and costs!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic roof pool and terrace”
Reviews.Author: Aerosmithfan
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed here (in fact we´re still here, writing the review from the hotel, on their free internet access!), for a long weekend. We love this place. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and speak good English. The breakfast bar has everything you could possibly fancy at that time of day (apart from the one member of our party who expressed a hankering for Owen Wilson). The rooftop terrace and swimming pool are wonderful after a long day walking around. There is also a jacuzzi, and the friendly staff will bring you drinks and snacks, very reasonably priced. Very nice to sit and have a drink in the evening before going out, as well. La Pedrera is within easy walking distance. The Ramblas and Barri Gotic are a little further away, but the Metro system is very easy to master, even if you don´t speak any Spanish. We recommend the Salamanca restaurant, down by the marina on Carrer de Salamanca. We paid 40 euros per head, but well worth it. Thoroughly recommended by all 5 of us.

Reviews.Title: “A wondeful treat”
Reviews.Author: mls91
Reviews.Content: Like others, I booked this hotel after reading Tripadvisor reviews. My husband, son and I had no complaints. The location was great, staff was friendly, accomodating, and informative. Breakfast served until 10:30 weekdays and 11 on weekends was fresh, well-presented, and plentiful. Decor was modern, rooms were clean, bathrooms a good size. The rooftop deck was the crowning touch. After a busy, hot August day of sightseeing, retiring to the lovely rooftop deck for sunset was fabulous. Others agreed and we met other hotel guests, all of whom were very pleased to be there. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Blooming
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the America Hotel with 3 girl friends for 4 nights 29 June to 3 July 2006. We LOVED the pool area and spent a lot of time making use of the fantastic bed-like loungers and the refreshment service (just pick up the phone and order - It was my 30th when we were away and the hotel kindly gave us a free bottle of cava by the pool!). We stayed at this hotel partly due to the other good tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We had breakfast included in our price, so can't comment on whether it was expensive. Hotel was in a great location and felt a very safe area for girls walking home at night. If we had any niggles it was that one of the rooms smelt a bit smoky, which we think was connected to the air con. The other room was fine though and both were clean. All four of us said we would definitely stay here again if we came back to Barcelona - which we will as we all loved the city.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay at the America”
Reviews.Author: Helen004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the America at the end of June for 5 nights. Very pleased with our stay although had been a bit worried it might be noisy as some other reviewers had commented. Our stay wasn't marred by undue noise but can see that if a rowdy crowd were in then the noise would certainly travel due to the layout of the hotel. Room very nice (floor to ceiling window) and kept very clean. Hotel staff always pleasant and helpful. Pool and jacuzzui great after a day sightseeing and open til 8pm. Breakfast expensive so ate out at the Apeadoro at the end of the road. Lovely evening meal at La Provenca across the road. TIP: When paying the bill opt to pay in your own currency or the Spanish bank slap on a 2% surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KateChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel America from May 28 to June 4 and loved it. It was conveniently located - within walking distance to Las Ramblas, La Sagrada Familia, and La Pedrera, and close to the train which can take you anywhere else you want to go. This was our first trip to Barcelona and my husband and I loved it. Barcelona is now our favorite city in the world - we had such a great vacation. I looked at trip advisor before we left and chose Hotel America based on the great reviews it got and we were not disappointed. We found the room to be very clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Juan at the desk. I have traveled a great deal and am pretty spoiled when it comes to hotels but Hotel America lived up to all of my expectations. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in this hotel again on my future trips to Barcelona. If you are looking for a clean, safe, convenient, comfortable, friendly place to stay, stay at the Hotel America.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cristinel
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, nice staff, not exactly centric, but near the subway station, so no problems there. Rooms and bathrooms are trendy tasteful modern and clean but smallish - paper thin walls, you can hear every TV, conversation and most annoyingly, every shower or flushing toilet nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: mitoboy3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel America from May 30th to June 2nd, 2006 and I have to say I was somewhat disspointed. I made my reservation here based on the reviews on this website. I have to say that in the past the reviews were dead on, bu this time, I think that the reviews on this hotel are somewhat overrated. We arrived to find the room with an extremely musty smell. We had to open the windows in order to air out the room. The sheets and the towels had a strange smell. The Breakfast, good, but EXPENSIVE - try El Apeadero which is a block away on Proivenca. The gym that they advertise on their website, awfyul. The treadmill did not work, and the one weight machine was complicated to figure out. I do not think I will stay here again, considering there are much better 4 star hotels all over the Eixample.

Reviews.Title: “fab hen weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we reserved 5 perfectly wonderful twin rooms for a hen weekend! The rooms were modern and clean with a mini bar(which they will empty for your own supplies), TV and hairdryer. I felt the hotel info book was a little on the lean side and the elecronic room safe kept locking itself with our money and passports inside! However, staff attended our needs very quickly and we only had to ask once for anything. On Sunday we used the roof pool area which was to die for! Especially after busy day sightseeing and a late night with the girls. Get there early to bag the few beds on offer. The giant sun-mattresses beat the sunbeds hands down on comfort and made us feel we'd really made it in the world! Dial 9 for bar/food service and sit back and enjoy. We bagged a minibus from the airport for 80eur which between 10 was a bargain. The hotel booked us 2 smaller minibuses for 130eur (for 2) for our return. Not that many bars in the hotel vicinity but there is a great one opposite the hotel with a fabulous relaxing area upstairs with a giant leather bed and trendy cubes. Beer 2eur each but the vodka was a bit pricy. Hard Rock cafe highly recommended but we had to wait ages for a table as they don't take bookings for <15. It simply meant we had plenty of time to spend and sample the cocktails in the lower bar, so no complaints there! The food portions were ace and very good value. Catch a taxi to Port Olimpique for 9-10eur and you can find some good restaurants and enjoy a proper pub crawl! The pubs were a bit too spread out for our liking along the Ramblas so go straight for the port if you want the buzz of a good night out. We took the sightseeing bus at 11am on Saturday but get there earlier if you want a top deck place.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nealog
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in May and it was a wonderful experience! The staff were very friendly, the room was clean and had all the facilities we needed. We found it very handy to get to, right off P. de Gracia, a 10 walk from where the Airport bus drops you in the Palca Catalunya. It is a lovely neighbourhood, nice and quiet and just down from one of Gaudis buildings. HINT: If you're going home from the red line tourist bus, stay on till the Pedreras stop, saves a few mins. Found a great restaraunt just up the road on the P de gracis called Samoa, one of the best Pizza's i have ever tasted! The hotels roof terrace and pool etc is top quality! Very well laid out, as expected its not an olympic size pool, but very nice and clean. Staff more than happy to bring up beers, towels food etc. All in all a great time, will be going back to barcelona and will definitely stay at Hotel America...and this time I'm going to amatch and i'm driving in the Smart car!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: clobella
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the America was excellent. The position is great, about five minutes walk from the Ramblas and Passeig de Gracia . It's very modern, not too large and extremely clean. Our room was a good size, bed very comfortable with plenty of storage space. Good bathroom with great variety of toiletries, hairdryer and magnifying mirror and huge towels plus towelling robe. Staff are all very friendly and there was always someone around if you needed them. The breakfasts were the best surprise - huge choice of everything plus plenty of exotic fresh fruit. Lovely bread and croissants and cakes! Bar area is filled with plenty of comfortable settees with free internet access plus plenty of guide books and others to browse through. Hotel umbrellas available too! Dinner recommendations were superb - there are lots of nice restaurants in the area which are not typically touristy. Although I didn't go to the roof I was told that the pool area was good. A good price and nice place to stay if you want to be away from the noisy end of the Ramblas. Also felt quite safe walking around with a handbag.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dunoon44
Reviews.Content: Date: March 28th 2006 Reviewer: A Trip Advisor Member, Scotland We have just returned from a 4 night break at the Hotel America Barcelona. The hotel was excellent and the staff very helpful and friendly. Good breakfast very clean rooms, good location central to metro station all in all our stay was 10/10. Was not brave enough to drive the free 4 hour Smart Car which is on offer. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having read the reviews of other travelers i was not dissopointed a very modern hotel in the right location just a short walk to the ramblers local bars and restaurants beware of the traffic in barcelona its a nightmare. the staff at this hotel are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble, jump in a taxi from the airport 25 euros takes 30 mins, a bus will take forever. the hotel is spotless and cleaners are everywhere i have stayed in a lot of places in spain but this rates of one of my best. its very easy to get lost in barcelona all the streets are the same take a map with you and enjoy a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “.MODERN CLEAN HOTEL.GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY. BUT NOISY..”
Reviews.Author: f100zardoz
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in the 'America Hotel' for six nights at the end of march.The taxi ride from the airport only cost 15 euro { We fonud the taxi's in barcelona to be very cheap and reliable, from the hotel to las rambels is about 4 euro between two people if you flag it on the street.}First impressions of the room were excellent.It was modern bright & clean with a mini fridge which we filled with our own water e.t.c. Can't fault the hotel on anything except the noise.As you have read in other reveiws the floors are wooden & the walls must not be insulated so at one stage i could actually hear someone somewhere having a shower ! The breakfast was great {my wife tryed everything!}The rooms had air-con & a large clean , stylish bathroom.Overall a very pleasent stay helped by friendly and courtious staff.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but clean and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: KatieKEW
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for a weekend in March. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. We had no problems with noise and the beds were comfy. The location was decent as it's only a step away from the metro which gets you everywhere quickly! We didn't have any food in the hotel, we thought it was overpriced. Coffee was good though and the rooftop is fab even in March. La Pedrera is a few minutes walk away as is all the higher end shopping eg Gucci. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel all things considered and £70 per room seemed a bargain. NB Take you own hairdryer, the bathroom ones are next to useless - reception will lend you a travel plug if you are silly enough to bring an American one as I did! Barcelona was a great city with loads to do and very friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: ip202659
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is quite an overrated hotel. I stayed here between Christmas and New Year's Eve 2005, had booked a single room (100 Euros) and was treated to a windowless, tiny room. Decor is modern indeed, but not of the best taste. A gym is available, but it merely consists of a small weights machine, a bicycle and a "running" machine. Service is pretty indifferent. The hotel lobby is extremely small and really unsuitable to wind down after a day spent strolling through the magnificent city that is Barcelona. In all, this was probably a 2 or 3 star that was refurbished in a "modern" fashion to look more costly, but deep down can't really hide its roots. I had booked 3 nights, only stayed the 1st and went to the NH Calderón for the other 2. My God, what a difference ! For about the same price it was a huge difference in comfort and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel! But Bring Your Earplugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based on price and other trip advisor reviews. I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel was a great bargain(about $100 per night in December)! The staff was friendly and spoke English. They had free internet access downstairs which was a great way to do quick email checks (although, I will say you have to be patient with the speed). The room was comfortable and large and the bathroom-although cold in December-was also large. The location was about 3 blocks from the top of Las Ramblas, but my husband and I are "walkers" anyway, so it didn't bother us. Everything was going great until the first morning when we awoke to EVERYONE'S morning routines!! Because the hotel is so modern, there is no carpet in the halls and the floors aren't sealed off(you can look all the way down and see the lobby), so everything echos. My husband also noticed how thin the doors were and we could hear plumbing! It sounds aweful, but luckily, I never travel without earplugs and once we put them in, all was right with the world! I would recommend this hotel, but I would definitely warn someone if they are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: suemaxster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel America Barcelona for 3 nights from the 16th December 2005. The hotel is clean, friendly and well situated yet far enough away from the lively La Ramblas to get a good nights sleep. The breakfast is great and at Euro 14 if not included in your rate is good value for what is available on the buffet. Ask for a high room at the back of the hotel, because although the view is not great it keeps you away from the road. The staff at the hotel are great and speak good english which if you do not speak spanish makes things so much easier. Took a taxi both ways from the airport cost Euro 25 each way, but make sure you put your seat belt on because no driver in Barcelona takes any prisoners. Barcelona is a great place to visit with lots to do and I would recommend the bus tours which have 3 routes ( 2 in winter) which covers all the main attractions with ease. This hotel is a good base for a visit to a interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent. The Hotel America, is a boutique hotel that has a perfect location. I picked a hotel based on your website and the reviews. I had the oportunity to stay there after a cruise, and must say, we were very pleased with everything abaut this hotel. I just wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “loved the america hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really had a wonderful stay.I used to change hotel every time i was visiting barcelona, but from now on i will not:after i found this nice place i am going to be a faitful guest of this hotel. nice rooms, friendly people, perfect location...great music at the bar....what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked this nice hotel: the perfect place to have a week-end. The rooms are confortable and the bar has a great atmosphere. People at the reception are very frendly and helpfull. Very good breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Don't use the airport taxis!”
Reviews.Author: Chriswalkley
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, my personal favourite in Barcelona (out of the 4 or 5 I've stayed in. A word of warning, do not use the taxis at the airport, they will cheat you and will try to charge up 80 euros if they think they can get away with it. Get the airport shuttle to Plac de Catalunya and a taxi from there to your hotel - costs about 6 euros....you do the maths! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved hotel America”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in the hotel america for a week and we loved it. We had a superior room with jacuzzi, spectacular bath window to the room. king size bed, DVD player, HIFI cordless, etc. There is a roof top area in the 7 th. floor whith pool and jacuzzi and with views over Barcelona (Sagrada Familia, Tibidabo mountain, Monjuic, etc.) Location was very very good. 5 mts to Paseo de Gracia and 15 mts to Plaza Cataluna. The staff was friendly and very polite. I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, free internet access in bar/lobby area. Can be loud at night, but did not bother us. Great location! Would recommend and stay again. Helpful staff at front desk. Spoke good english when our spanish was not clear.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our staying in Hotel America was really a new experience. Elegant, comfortable. The staff was so kind and efficient to anticipate our needs and whishes. Breackfast was very rich, various and appetizing. We apprecieted so much the car that Hotel gave us for free four our touring in Barcelona. We will for sure come back to Hotel America.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: D4T4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here... rooms a bit different from the regular med. Very stylish and clean. Pool a little small (it is a rooftop one after all) and cold! Service - excellent. Location - good, slightly outside of the touristy areas but walkable to las ramblas. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- try it”
Reviews.Author: paulpreston
Reviews.Content: hotel is in good area within easy walking distance of las rambla and bus stops for hopper tours. the rooms were good size for a city centre hotel and are very clean. the staff are friendly, helpful and even got us a hotel umbrella for the day it rained. roof top pool is a good area to relax and get some sun after a day of walking. breakfast seemed a bit expensive at 15 euros Barcelona its self is clean and not as threatening as other reviews made out. perhaps you need to look after bags etc more than other cities. overall well worth using this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and funky. Great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: jenniferindublin
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern in a great area of town. I don't know if I would call area residential as others have - there is a lot going on. It is about 10 blocks removed from the mayhem but easy enough to get there if you want by metro or taxi (cheap taxis!). The only complaint was that it was a bit loud, but it didn't keep us up. We got the Barcelona card as our travel books recommended but didn't find the value in it. I would recommend just taking the metro and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this place enough. Great location, friendly service, with nice, clean, modern rooms. The pool area is great for relaxing after you've done the sights or for a pre dinner drink before you head off to the many nice bars and restaurants in the area. You'd be hard pressed to find a hotel of this standard for the same reasonable price - we'll definitely stay there again next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Class Base - especially in hot weather !”
Reviews.Author: PaulLeicesterEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel America at the begining of July for a long weekend. The hotel was chosen via the internet after reading mostly excellent reports. Although not the cheapest hotel, Barcelona is relatively expensive and as of many major cities in the world, accomodation standards vary widely. Unless you are comparing this hotel to hotels such as the Ritz etc. it would be harsh to give a bad review. What you have at "around" £100/night is a modern, bright, funcky hotel with excellent rooms...bright spacious with modern furniture, air/con, digital safe, mini bar, t.v, sofa, excellent shower etc., my only one moan was no tea or coffee making facilities, but then there is 24 hour room service, prices being very reasonable. The features I liked best were the roof top swimming pool and jacuzzi...again the weather needs to be hot to take advantage, when we went it was drizzling and cloudy believe it or not, this being July!...oh well. The small bar seemed to lack atmosphere, the staff are very attentive and friendly. the other excellent feature was the breakfast dinning room. Breakfast cost us 13 Euro each per day, while not being as cheap as a coffee and croissant if eating out what you do get is a fabulous buffett stlye breakfast with tea/coffee and "full english fry up" served in a impecabbly clean and stylish dinning room...well worth it, p.s , what a "quality" fruit selection !. Early morning room calls and check out are brilliant...nothing is too much trouble...taxi waiting at the door. How anyone could complain about this hotel is beyond me. The location is top quality too, far removed from the run down areas near La Ramblas but a nearby sub way links all areas with a 5 minute stroll at "Diagonal" to make it an excellent base. Many people rave about Barcelona, I must be the exception to the rule. I found the city too large to enjoy. The shops are no different than many major towns in many countries, of course you do have the real top class shopping and would be great if you like that sort of thing and have the money to take advantage of them, not "my cup of tea". The port area was quite when we visited, not that impressed with the harbour area lined with typical english tourist tat cafes..give them a miss. I found the Barri Gothic quarter the best and El Raval a close second, brilliant small shops and cafes. As for La Ramblas...what a dump. There is an unease as you walk about, always expecting to get robbed, pickpocketed or bag snatched, this is a disgrace on the local police for not doing more to stamp out a REAL AND PROLIFIC PROBLEM especially given the city depends on the tourist trade. "Some" taxi drivers will also "take advantage" ( or is the term theft ! ) of people being ignorant to the tariff system and will try and add on "baggage charges" etc when calculating the fare, count the change also BEFORE getting out of the cab , pre-booking via the hotel is a better bet. There is a seedy area near Paral-lel sub station ...take care, many prostitutes and north african people hang out on the streets and thats in the day time, heaven only knows what it is like at night. Ironically a lunch "set menu" at a restaurant on Carrer De Sant Pau was one of the best I have ever had, be prepared to wait for a table despite it's quite location. Well each to his own, don't let me put you off the city, if you really want to visit the Hotel America will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at the hotel America in Barcelona and we loved it. The rooms were lovely and clean and if you are lucky enough to get a corner room as we were you get some great views. The rooftop pool was a real plus too. Great place to stay but would avoid the weekend if we came back as large groups of people overcrowded the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “funky , groovy hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie84
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hotel America in Barcelona. I am 21 and my boyfriend is 22 went for a relaxing weekend away. We arrived at the hotel quite late in the evening but the staff were excellent as they were throughout the trip. Room was a bit smaller than expected however the decoration and bathroom were lovely ,cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Free air conditioning and safety deposit box were a bonus. Anything u want the staff will get it for you. Roof top pool and terrace was perfectly proportioned and layed out with a lovely big bed at the end, felt quite privileged to have a pool to return to after a long days sightseeing being that it is a city hotel. The only down sides to this hotel is the prices at the bar and the food best to go elsewhere for drinks if u are not wanting to pay the prices. Another down side is that the hotel is a good 30-40 min walk from the main part of La Rambla despite what other reviews might say believe me!! We have the scars on our feet to prove it! Despite this we thoroughly enjoyed the the hotel and bercelona.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: mickrory
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel America week commencing 7 March. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean and spotless, the rooms are constructed around a central atrium with the restaurant situated on the first floor, we were on the second floor so didn't have to bother with the lift. We also went up on the roof terrace from which you can make out the Sagrada Family along the road the hotel is adjacent to. Although sunny we didn't brave the pool. Never noticed the noise other posters have mentioned but we did stay midweek. They also provided breakfast buffet at 2 for 1 @ 14.25 Euros and there was plenty of fresh fruit, eggs bacon sausage, pastries, toast etc etc. Staff were very helpful and minibar selection was varied and not extortionate. Hotel is about a mile from Catalunya Square but it was a pleasant walk in every morning via Ramblas Da Catalunya which is a couple of blocks away. Beds were very comfortable but we walked so much everyday we were out like lights once we hit the pillow. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again when we return

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel America
HotelInfo.Address: c/ Provenca 195, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
